author: Special Correspondent
text: DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin on Friday said DMDK leader Vijayakant’s decision to go it alone in the Assembly polls would not affect the DMK’s poll prospects. On Thursday, the Mr Vijayakant had turned down the DMK’s invitation for an electoral alliance. Interacting with journalists here, Mr Stalin said the DMK president M Karunanidhi had invited Mr Vijayakant for an alliance with good intentions. “Accepting or rejecting the invitation is the prerogative of the DMDK. We cannot compel them,” he said.
title: DMDK decision won’t affect DMK’s prospects: Stalin
